alert.note: Alert for West Slopes of the Central Cascades Generally above 1500 Feet (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 23 at 3:53AM PDT until August 25 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 659... The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Thursday morning through Friday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 659 West Slopes of the Central Cascades Generally above 1500 Feet. * WINDS...East 10 to 15 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as the lower 20s. * HAINES...Mid-level Haines Index 6 or high potential for large plume dominated fire growth. * IMPACTS...A dry and unstable air mass with warm temperatures can contribute to active fire behavior. In western Washington, significant growth on existing fires takes place under such conditions. If a fire were to begin, air quality may diminish in the surrounding area.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that there is a potential for critical fire weather conditions to develop. Monitor the forecasts for possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: West Slopes of the Central Cascades Generally above 1500 Feet
